title: Wilderness Ditch

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Wilderness wall
Wilderness Ditch
Released18 April 2007 (Update)
MembersNo
QuestNo
LocationWilderness border
OptionsCross
ExamineJump here.
Map
Advanced data
Object ID23271

The Wilderness ditch is a long, narrow ditch that separates the Wilderness from the rest of Gielinor. The player must jump over the ditch to get into or out of the Wilderness. It was created to warn players about entering the Wilderness and to help prevent luring.

The Wilderness ditch can also be used to train Magic and Ranged because enemies on the other side, such as skeletons, are unable to attack over the ditch.

Warning: Beware of other players while on the Wilderness side! Players can attack each other here, and items will be lost on death.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Between 28 April 2021 and 27 April 2022, there was no music track defined for the tiles one tile south of the ditch. If the player had logged out on the tile south of the ditch and logged back in, no music would have been playing until they either cross the ditch or move one tile south. After an update, adjacent non-Wilderness music tracks were set to play at these tiles but only Parade is impossible to be heard there because trees were added at the previously-accessible eastern end of the ditch to prevent free-to-play players from unlocking this track.
  • The removal or replacement of the Wilderness ditch with a more thematic barrier while still being effective against luring has been polled on five separate occasions, in polls #24, #59, #73, #116 and #147.

The '''Wilderness ditch''' is a long, narrow ditch that separates the [[Wilderness]] from the rest of [[Gielinor]]. The player must jump over the ditch to get into or out of the Wilderness. It was created to warn players about entering the Wilderness and to help prevent [[luring]].

The Wilderness ditch can also be used to train [[Magic]] and [[Ranged]] because enemies on the other side, such as [[skeletons]], are unable to attack over the ditch.

'''{{Colour|red|Warning}}:''' Beware of other players while on the Wilderness side! Players can attack each other here, and items will be lost on death.

==Trivia==
*Between [[28 April]] [[2021]] and [[27 April]] [[2022]], there was no music track defined for the tiles one tile south of the ditch. If the player had logged out on the tile south of the ditch and logged back in, no music would have been playing until they either cross the ditch or move one tile south. After an [[Update:Beneath Cursed Sands|update]], adjacent non-Wilderness music tracks were set to play at these tiles but only [[Parade]] is impossible to be heard there because [[Tree|trees]] were added at the previously-accessible eastern end of the ditch to prevent [[free-to-play]] players from unlocking this track.
*The removal or replacement of the Wilderness ditch with a more thematic barrier while still being effective against [[luring]] has been [[Polls|polled]] on five separate occasions, in polls [[Poll:Old School feature poll 15: Rejuvenating the Wilderness|#24]], [[Poll:Old School Content Poll 30: Near Miss Poll|#59]], [[Poll:Deadman and Ditch|#73]], [[Poll:Old School Content Poll 57: Quests, Buffs & QoL|#116]] and [[Poll:Quality of Life - Mostly Re-runs 2019|#147]].
